title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: easiest way install cbbplotR using pak package:
code: if (!require("pak")) install.packages("pak") pak::pak("andreweatherman/cbbplotR")

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: Following vignette require installing cbbdata package registering free API key:
code: pak::pak("andreweatherman/cbbdata") library(cbbplotR) library(cbbdata) library(tidyverse) library(gt) acc_team_data <- cbd_torvik_ratings(year = 2024, conf = 'ACC') conf_data <- cbd_torvik_conf_factors(year = 2024) %>% slice(1:10) facet_data <- cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings_archive(year = 2024) %>%    summarize(avg_rating = mean(barthag), .by = c(conf, date)) %>%    filter(conf %in% c('ACC', 'B10', 'B12'))

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: Generating logo plots can achieved using geom_cbb_teams function specifying aes layer points proper team column data. Let’s create simple logo plot visualizes adjusted efficiencies ACC.  just functions, pulled data, plotted team values, drawn conference-average lines, added labels. simplicity makes cbbplotR invaluable tool data analysis college basketball. available, can plot dark logos setting logo_type “dark.”
code: acc_team_data %>%    ggplot(aes(adj_o, adj_d, team = team)) +   geom_cbb_teams(width = 0.10) +   geom_mean_lines(aes(x0 = adj_o, y0 = adj_d), color = 'black') +   theme_minimal() +   theme(plot.title.position = 'plot',         plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold')) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Efficiencies in the ACC',        x = 'Adjusted Offense',        y = 'Adjusted Defense') acc_team_data %>%    ggplot(aes(adj_o, adj_d, team = team)) +   geom_cbb_teams(width = 0.10, logo_type = "dark") +   geom_mean_lines(aes(x0 = adj_o, y0 = adj_d), color = 'black') +   hrbrthemes::theme_modern_rc() +   theme(plot.title.position = 'plot',         plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold')) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Efficiencies in the ACC',        x = 'Adjusted Offense',        y = 'Adjusted Defense')

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: Using process , can quickly create scatter plot conference logos! can also specify logo_type = "wordmark" plot conference wordmarks instead logos.  important caveat: Conferences weird. Many logos different dimensions might require fine-tuning inside aes adjusting size parameter certain ones. cbbplotR automatically resize conferences, might sufficient needs.
code: conf_data %>%    ggplot(aes(adj_o, adj_d, conference = conf)) +   geom_cbb_conferences(width = 0.12) +   geom_mean_lines(aes(x0 = adj_o, y0 = adj_d), color = 'black') +   theme_minimal() +   theme(plot.title.position = 'plot',         plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold')) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Efficiencies Across Top 10 Conferences',        x = 'Adjusted Offense',        y = 'Adjusted Defense')

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: cbbplotR, can also incorporate player headshots visualizations. cbbplotR provide helper function retrieve ESPN player IDs, get_espn_players, guarantee player names match across data source – including cbbdata. support player name matching.
code: set.seed(50)  player_ids <- get_espn_players('Duke')  random_data <- tibble(   val1 = rnorm(nrow(player_ids)),   val2 = rnorm(nrow(player_ids)),   id = player_ids$id )  random_data %>%    ggplot(aes(val1, val2)) +   geom_cbb_headshots(aes(player_id = id, width = 0.1)) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot'   ) +   labs(title = 'Random data to show plotting headshots')

what: But I have too many teams // want to focus on a select few!
title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: lot Division 1 basketball teams, drawing effective plots hundreds logos challenging. One standout features cbbplotR ability highlight specific elements plots. particularly useful dealing large number logos data points, want draw attention key items. can apply highlighting teams, conferences, players. Highlighting cbbplotR designed intuitive flexible. several methods disposal: Transparency Adjustment: setting low alpha level elements except ones wish highlight, can subtly bring forward focus points keeping context background. Grayscale Application: Another method involves converting non-essential logos grayscale, making colored logos highlighted teams conferences stand vividly.

previous_headings: But I have too many teams // want to focus on a select few!
title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: Implementing methods straightforward. can adjust data manually, providing alphaand/color values certain teams, pass values aes layer – let cbbplotR heavy lifting. Without needing touch data, can pass vector teams, conferences, player IDs highlight_X argument geom_cbb_X functions specify highlight type – alpha, color, . example, let’s assume want highlight four Tobacco Road teams still show position relative rest ACC.  example, chose highlight teams increasing transparency changing logos grayscale non-selected teams. can choose , highlight_method = "", just one, highlight_method = "alpha" // highlight_method = "color". process analogous geom methods – argument names switch relative function (highlight_conferences highlight_players).
code: acc_team_data %>%   ggplot(aes(adj_o, adj_d, team = team)) +   geom_cbb_teams(highlight_teams = c('Duke', 'North Carolina', 'Wake Forest', 'North Carolina St.'), width = 0.08, highlight_method = 'both') +   geom_mean_lines(aes(x0 = adj_o, y0 = adj_d), color = 'black') +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot'   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Efficiencies in the ACC (highlight: transparency)',        x = 'Adjusted defense',        y = 'Adjusted offense')

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: cbbplotR extends standard capabilities ggplot2 allowing place logos headshots various parts plot, axes labels inline plot titles.

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: element_cbb_teams, element_cbb_conferences, element_cbb_headshots, can replace traditional axis text logos headshots. Like geom_cbb_X functions, element_cbb_X functions just intuitive! Now, let’s plot adjusted offensive efficiency ACC placing team names X-axis.  just like , team logos axis! can similarly player headshots conference logos. conference logos, can similarly plot logos wordmarks using logo_type argument. Let’s try one example using player headshots.
code: acc_team_data %>%   ggplot(aes(team, adj_o)) +   geom_col() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot',     axis.text.x = element_cbb_teams(size = 0.9)   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Efficiencies in the ACC',        y = 'Adjusted offense',        x = NULL) set.seed(50)  player_ids <- get_espn_players('Duke')  random_data <- tibble(   val1 = rnorm(nrow(player_ids)),   val2 = rnorm(nrow(player_ids)),   id = player_ids$id )  random_data %>%    ggplot(aes(id, val2)) +   geom_col() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot',     axis.text.x = element_cbb_headshots(size = 0.8)   ) +   labs(title = 'Random data to show plotting headshots',        x = NULL)

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: element_cbb_X functions also allow plotting facet titles. achieved using element function conjunction strip.text.x strip.text.y.
code: facet_data %>%    ggplot(aes(date, avg_rating)) +   geom_line() +   facet_wrap(~conf) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot',     strip.text.x = element_cbb_conferences(size = 1)   ) +   labs(title = 'Average T-Rank Rating for Select Conferences in 2024',        x = 'Date',        y = 'T-Rank Rating')

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: cbbplotR provides powerful functionalities incorporating team conference colors ggplot2 visualizations. using scale_color/fill_cbb_X functions, can easily map aesthetic properties plots official colors college basketball teams conferences. make functions work, simply assign color /fill properties aes team conference columns, add appropriate scale function.

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: scale_color_cbb_teams scale_fill_cbb_teams  unctions allow assign team-specific colors various plot elements. scale_color_cbb_conferences  scale_fill_cbb_conferences functions work manner allow assign conference-specific color values.
code: acc_team_data %>%   ggplot(aes(team, adj_o, fill = team)) +   geom_col() +   scale_fill_cbb_teams() +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot',     axis.text.x = element_cbb_teams(size = 0.8)   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Efficiencies in the ACC',        y = 'Adjusted offense',        x = NULL)

what: My Plots pane is freezing in RStudio!
title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: plotting numerous team logos, might notice RStudio can slow return plot – can possibly lead R session aborting. fix , cbbplotR borrows function ggpath package called ggpreview – saves temporary image plot returns  Viewer pane. recommend expand window browser. use ggpreview, need store plot variable pass ggpreview function. function also takes arguments plot dimensions. example, draw plot showing every team’s adjusted efficiencies, require rendering 362 logos, definitely cause us problems. ggpreview, can store plot variable view temporary image ! entire process takes fewer 10 seconds.
code: p <- cbbdata::cbd_torvik_ratings(year = 2024) %>%   ggplot(aes(adj_d, adj_o, team = team)) +   geom_mean_lines(aes(x0 = adj_d, y0 = adj_o), color = 'black') +   geom_cbb_teams(width = 0.03) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(face = 'bold', size = 14),     plot.title.position = 'plot'   ) +   labs(title = 'Adjusted Team Efficiencies',        x = 'Adjusted defense',        y = 'Adjusted offense')  ggpreview(p)

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: cbbplotR ships number utility functions use conjunction gt tables package. Notably, cbbplotR ports cbd_gt_logos gt_theme_athletic functions cbbdata – former now called gt_cbb_teams formally deprecated cbbdata package consistency.

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: mentioned, gt_cbb_teams gt_cbb_conferences functions allow seamless integration team conference logos table columns. practicality, conference wordmarks able plotted. wish hide names table, can set include_names argument FALSE.  can thing conference data . default, conference names excluded table.
code: acc_team_data %>%    slice(1:5) %>%    select(team, barthag, barthag_rk, adj_o, adj_d) %>%    gt_cbb_teams(team, team) %>%    gt() %>%    fmt_markdown(team) conf_data %>%    slice(1:5) %>%    select(conf, barthag, adj_o, adj_d, adj_t) %>%   gt_cbb_conferences(conf, conf) %>%    gt() %>%    fmt_markdown(conf)

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: cbbplotR includes two helper functions filling cell bodies. win/loss column wish fill based results, gt_color_results function quick solution. can pass traditional column ‘W’ ‘L’ values, can pass boolean values set result_type argument binary. default, function expects results column named result can changed using result_column argument.  utility function gt_bold_rows. general catch-term function allows set background color font weight particular rows. can either pass empty function, can declare statement identifies rows alter. wrote function often find needing bold highlight certain rows condition true. example, let’s bold highlight rows cyl == 4 mtcars data set.  can extend compound filters. example, let’s thing rows cyl == 4 hp > 90. highlight two rows.
code: df <- data.frame(   result = c(1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1),   val1 = runif(6) )  df %>%    gt() %>%    gt_color_results(result_type = 'binary') mtcars %>%    slice(1:10) %>%    gt() %>%    gt_bold_rows(filter_statement = "cyl == 4",                highlight_color = 'darkblue',                text_color = 'white') mtcars %>%    slice(1:10) %>%    gt() %>%    gt_bold_rows(filter_statement = "cyl == 4 & hp > 90",                highlight_color = 'darkblue',                text_color = 'white')

title: Getting Started with cbbplotR
text: cbbplotR ships three functions alter appearance gt tables. first gt_cbb_logo_title – function neatly adds conference logo, team logo, player headshot heading space table. work function, need declare optional title subtitle name item plot. Alternatively, can supply custom link, logo_link, plot image. can adjust various things title subtitle , including logo_height. example, let’s plot mtcars data set add Duke’s logo.  Second, gt_set_fonts quick--easy solution changing font across aspects gt table. inferior fine-tuning allowed using tab_style functions nice quick tables. default, function attempt load font Google Fonts. rather font loaded system, set from_google_font FALSE.  Lastly, cbbplotR includes nice gt tables theme perfect box scores mono-spaced themes. inspired Athletic publication.
code: title <- gt_cbb_logo_title(title = 'mtcars data',                   subtitle = 'some random subtitle',                   type = 'team',                   value = 'Duke',                   logo_height = 45)  mtcars %>%    slice(1:10) %>%    gt() %>%    tab_header(title = html(title)) mtcars %>%    slice(1:10) %>%    gt() %>%    gt_set_font('Oswald') %>%    tab_header(title = 'mtcars') mtcars %>%    slice(1:10) %>%    gt() %>%    gt_theme_athletic() %>%    tab_header(title = 'mtcars')

title: cbbplotR Package
text: Welcome cbbplotR, R package designed bring vibrant world college basketball data visualizations. package, extension nflplotR, go-toolkit incorporating college basketball team conference logos, player headshots, team colors ggplot2 plots gt tables. cbbplotR best paired cbbdata package, extensive internal name conversion function teams conferences match common sites. want request adding specific name conversions, please open issue package’s GitHub. cbbplotR extension popular {sport}plotR family packages, including nflplotR, nbaplotR, mlbplotR, cfbplotR. package heavily adapted nflplotR ggpath developer Sebastian Carl.

title: cbbplotR Package
text: get started cbbplotR, can install using pak package.
code: if (!require("pak")) install.packages("pak") pak::pak("andreweatherman/cbbplotR")

what: Theme elements for ggplot2 to Visualize College Basketball Elements — element_cbb
title: Theme elements for ggplot2 to Visualize College Basketball Elements — element_cbb
text: functions enable use images non-data parts ggplot2 layers, specifically visualizing elements related college basketball.

title: Theme elements for ggplot2 to Visualize College Basketball Elements — element_cbb
code: element_cbb_teams(   alpha = NULL,   colour = NA,   hjust = NULL,   vjust = NULL,   color = NULL,   size = 0.5,   logo_type = "normal" )  element_cbb_headshots(   player_id_column,   alpha = NULL,   colour = NA,   hjust = NULL,   vjust = NULL,   color = NULL,   size = 1.5 )  element_cbb_conferences(   alpha = NULL,   colour = NA,   hjust = NULL,   vjust = NULL,   color = NULL,   size = 0.5,   logo_type = "normal" )  # S3 method for element_cbb_teams element_grob(   element,   label = "",   x = NULL,   y = NULL,   alpha = NULL,   colour = NULL,   hjust = 0.5,   vjust = 0.5,   size = NULL,   ... )  # S3 method for element_cbb_headshots element_grob(   element,   label = "",   x = NULL,   y = NULL,   alpha = NULL,   colour = NULL,   hjust = 0.5,   vjust = 0.5,   size = NULL,   ... )  # S3 method for element_cbb_conferences element_grob(   element,   label = "",   x = NULL,   y = NULL,   alpha = NULL,   colour = NULL,   hjust = 0.5,   vjust = 0.5,   size = NULL,   ... )

title: Theme elements for ggplot2 to Visualize College Basketball Elements — element_cbb
text: alpha transparency level 0-1. hjust, vjust Horizontal vertical adjustment 0-1. color (Optional) Colorization images; use "b/w" black white. size Size output grob cm. logo_type Type logo use ('normal' 'wordmark' // 'normal' 'dark'), applicable element_cbb_conferences element_cbb_teams. player_id_column Column name player IDs, applicable element_cbb_headshots. ... Arguments passed ggpath::element_path colour,color image colorized color. Use special character "b/w" set black white. information valid color names ggplot2 see https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/articles/ggplot2-specs.html?q=colour#colour--fill. hjust,vjust horizontal vertical adjustment respectively. Must numerical value 0 1. angle angle element numerical value 0° 360°.

title: Theme elements for ggplot2 to Visualize College Basketball Elements — element_cbb
text: S3 object class element appropriate use ggplot2 theme settings.

title: Theme elements for ggplot2 to Visualize College Basketball Elements — element_cbb
text: element_cbb_teams(): Replaces text team logos ggplot2 themes. element_cbb_conferences(): Replaces text conference logos ggplot2 themes. element_cbb_headshots(): Replaces ESPN player IDs player headshots ggplot2 themes.

what: Visualize College Basketball Conference Logos in ggplot2 — geom_cbb_conferences
title: Visualize College Basketball Conference Logos in ggplot2 — geom_cbb_conferences
text: geom_cbb_conferences creates ggplot2 layer plots college basketball conference logos place points. layer requires x y aesthetics valid conference name. width parameter can used adjust size logos. Logos can depicted either normal wordmark setting logo_type parameter.

title: Visualize College Basketball Conference Logos in ggplot2 — geom_cbb_conferences
code: geom_cbb_conferences(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   ...,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = FALSE,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   logo_type = "normal",   highlight_conferences = NULL,   highlight_method = "alpha",   highlight_alpha = 0.5 )

title: Visualize College Basketball Conference Logos in ggplot2 — geom_cbb_conferences
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created ggplot2::aes() ggplot2::aes_(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). stat statistical transformation use data layer, string. position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. ... arguments passed layer(). na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend Logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders(). logo_type Character specifying type logos plot ("normal" "wordmark"). highlight_conferences Vector conference names highlight. highlight_method Method highlighting ("alpha", "color", ""). highlight_alpha Alpha value highlighted conferences.

what: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: geoms can used draw horizontal vertical reference lines ggplot. use data aesthetics x0 y0 compute median mean draw line. copied directly ggpath package.

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
code: geom_median_lines(...)  geom_mean_lines(...)

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: ... Arguments passed ggpath::geom_mean_lines, ggpath::geom_median_lines mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behavior default plot specification.

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: ggplot2 layer (ggplot2::layer()) can added plot created ggplot2::ggplot().

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: functions outsourced ggpath package. See ggpath::geom_median_lines ggpath::geom_mean_lines details.

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
text: geom_median_lines() geom_mean_lines() understand following aesthetics (least one bold aesthetics required): x0 - variable compute median/mean drawn vertical line. y0 - variable compute median/mean drawn horizontal line. alpha = NA - alpha channel, .e. transparency level, numerical value 0 1. color = "red" - color drawn lines. linetype = 2 - linetype drawn lines. size = 0.5 - size drawn lines. Deprecated ggplot2 v3.4.0, use linewidth instead. linewidth = 0.5 - width drawn lines. Starting ggplot2 v3.4.0.

title: ggplot2 Layer for Horizontal and Vertical Reference Lines — geom_lines
code: library(ggplot2)  # inherit top level aesthetics ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = disp, y = mpg, y0 = mpg, x0 = disp)) +   geom_point() +   geom_median_lines() +   geom_mean_lines(color = "blue") +   theme_minimal()   # draw horizontal line only ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = disp, y = mpg, y0 = mpg)) +   geom_point() +   geom_median_lines() +   geom_mean_lines(color = "blue") +   theme_minimal()   # draw vertical line only ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = disp, y = mpg, x0 = disp)) +   geom_point() +   geom_median_lines() +   geom_mean_lines(color = "blue") +   theme_minimal()   # choose your own value ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = disp, y = mpg)) +   geom_point() +   geom_median_lines(x0 = 400, y0 = 15) +   geom_mean_lines(x0 = 150, y0 = 30, color = "blue") +   theme_minimal()

what: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
title: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
text: function previews ggplot actual dimensions order see look saved. also significantly faster default preview RStudio ggplots created using cbbplotR. copied directly nflplotR.

title: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
code: ggpreview(   plot = ggplot2::last_plot(),   width = NA,   height = NA,   asp = NULL,   dpi = 300,   device = "png",   units = c("in", "cm", "mm", "px"),   scale = 1,   limitsize = TRUE,   bg = NULL,   ... )

title: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
text: plot Plot save, defaults last plot displayed. width, height Plot size units expressed units argument. supplied, uses size current graphics device. asp aspect ratio plot calculated width / height. numeric value (NULL) height plot recalculated height = width / asp. dpi Plot resolution. Also accepts string input: "retina" (320), "print" (300), "screen" (72). Applies raster output types. device Device use. Can either device function (e.g. png), one "eps", "ps", "tex" (pictex), "pdf", "jpeg", "tiff", "png", "bmp", "svg" "wmf" (windows ). NULL (default), device guessed based filename extension. units One following units width height arguments expressed: "", "cm", "mm" "px". scale Multiplicative scaling factor. limitsize TRUE (default), ggsave() save images larger 50x50 inches, prevent common error specifying dimensions pixels. bg Background colour. NULL, uses plot.background fill value plot theme. ... arguments passed graphics device function, specified device.

title: Preview ggplot in Specified Dimensions — ggpreview
text: return value, called side effects.

what: Bold rows in a GT table with optional filtering and highlighting — gt_bold_rows
title: Bold rows in a GT table with optional filtering and highlighting — gt_bold_rows
text: gt_bold_rows applies bold styling rows GT table. can specify rows bold filter statement default, rows bolded. also option change text color add background highlight color bolded rows.

title: Bold rows in a GT table with optional filtering and highlighting — gt_bold_rows
code: gt_bold_rows(   gt_object,   row = gt::everything(),   text_color = "black",   highlight_color = NULL,   filter_statement = NULL )

title: Bold rows in a GT table with optional filtering and highlighting — gt_bold_rows
text: gt_object GT table object. row vector row indices bold, default rows using gt::everything(). text_color color used text, default 'black'. highlight_color color used row background highlight, default 'white'. NULL, background color applied. filter_statement character string contains filter expression evaluated determine rows bold. valid R expression string, example, "column_name > 5". Default NULL, means filter applied.

title: Bold rows in a GT table with optional filtering and highlighting — gt_bold_rows
text: GT table object specified rows styled bold text, optionally changed text color background highlight.

title: Render in Conference Wordmarks in gt Tables — gt_cbb_conferences
code: gt_cbb_conferences(   data,   conf_column,   logo_column = "conf",   logo_height = 20,   include_name = FALSE,   vertical_align = "-30%" )

title: Render in Conference Wordmarks in gt Tables — gt_cbb_conferences
text: data Pass plotting data conf_column Indicate column contains team variable logo_column Indicates name HTML column logo_height height logo wordmark HTML string include_name conference name included column? Defaults FALSE wordmarks distinctive. vertical_align CSS styler vertical align; defaults -30%.

title: Render in Conference Wordmarks in gt Tables — gt_cbb_conferences
text: Returns data appended HTML column.

title: Render in Conference Wordmarks in gt Tables — gt_cbb_conferences
text: really hate putting conference logos names separate columns, helper function add conference wordmarks create HTML code render wordmarks columns column tables. using gt plot, must use fmt_markdown({logo_column}) render HTML. Set logo_column conf variable wish overwrite conf column logo HTML (recommended default).

code: gt_cbb_logo_title(   title,   subtitle,   value = NULL,   logo_link = NULL,   type = c("team", "conference", "headshot"),   title_font_size = 24,   title_font_weight = "bold",   title_lineheight = 0.5,   subtitle_font_size = 16,   subtitle_font_weight = "normal",   subtitle_lineheight = 0.5,   logo_height = 65 )

title: Add a Team Logo and Title/Subtitle to a gt Table. — gt_cbb_logo_title
text: title gt table title subtitle gt table subtitle logo_link want plot different image, pass valid URL link . title_font_size size title font (px). title_font_weight weight title (normal bold). title_lineheight line-height title. subtitle_font_size size subtitle font (px). subtitle_font_weight weight subtitle (normal bold). subtitle_lineheight line-height subtitle. logo_height height logo (px). team valid team name cbbdata.

text: data Pass plotting data team_column Indicate column contains team variable logo_column Indicates name HTML column logo_color Indicate whether want normal logos dark ones. logo_type Indicate whether want plot logos ('logo', default) wordmarks ('wordmark') logo_height height logo wordmark HTML string include_name conference name included column? Defaults FALSE wordmarks distinctive. vertical_align CSS styler vertical align; defaults -30%.

title: Render in Logo-Team HTML for Tables — gt_cbb_teams

Set logo_column team variable wish overwrite team column logo HTML (recommended default).

what: Color Rows in gt Table Based on Win/Loss Results — gt_color_results
title: Color Rows in gt Table Based on Win/Loss Results — gt_color_results
text: function styles rows gt table based win/loss results. allows customization colors text win loss rows. Users can specify column result data, customize colors, choose traditional win/loss binary result types.

title: Color Rows in gt Table Based on Win/Loss Results — gt_color_results
code: gt_color_results(   gt_object,   result_column = "result",   win_color = "#5DA271",   loss_color = "#C84630",   wins_text_color = "white",   loss_text_color = "white",   result_type = "wl" )

title: Color Rows in gt Table Based on Win/Loss Results — gt_color_results
text: gt_object gt table object. result_column name column data contains result indicators. Default 'result'. win_color background color rows indicating win. Default '#5DA271' (green). loss_color background color rows indicating loss. Default '#C84630' (red). wins_text_color text color rows indicating win. Default 'white'. loss_text_color text color rows indicating loss. Default 'white'. result_type type result indicators used result_column. Options 'wl' (default, 'W' 'L') 'binary' (1 0).

title: Color Rows in gt Table Based on Win/Loss Results — gt_color_results
text: gt table styled rows based win/loss results.

what: Color and Fill Scales for College Basketball Teams and Conferences — scale_cbb
title: Color and Fill Scales for College Basketball Teams and Conferences — scale_cbb
text: functions provide color fill scales ggplot2 based college basketball team conference colors.

title: Color and Fill Scales for College Basketball Teams and Conferences — scale_cbb
code: scale_color_cbb_teams(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "colour",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_colour_cbb_teams(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "colour",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_fill_cbb_teams(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "fill",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_color_cbb_conferences(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "colour",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_colour_cbb_conferences(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "colour",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )  scale_fill_cbb_conferences(   type = c("primary", "secondary"),   values = NULL,   ...,   aesthetics = "fill",   breaks = ggplot2::waiver(),   na.value = "grey50",   guide = NULL,   alpha = NA )

title: Color and Fill Scales for College Basketball Teams and Conferences — scale_cbb
text: type type color scale, either "primary" "secondary". values named list colors used overriding default team conference colors. ... Arguments passed discrete_scale palette palette function called single integer argument (number levels scale) returns values take (e.g., scales::pal_hue()). breaks One : NULL breaks waiver() default breaks (scale limits) character vector breaks function takes limits input returns breaks output. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. limits One : NULL use default scale values character vector defines possible values scale order function accepts existing (automatic) values returns new ones. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. drop unused factor levels omitted scale? default, TRUE, uses levels appear data; FALSE uses levels factor. na.translate Unlike continuous scales, discrete scales can easily show missing values, default. want remove missing values discrete scale, specify na.translate = FALSE. na.value na.translate = TRUE, aesthetic value missing values displayed ? apply position scales NA always placed far right. aesthetics names aesthetics scale works . scale_name name scale used error messages associated scale. labels One : NULL labels waiver() default labels computed transformation object character vector giving labels (must length breaks) expression vector (must length breaks). See ?plotmath details. function takes breaks input returns labels output. Also accepts rlang lambda function notation. call call used construct scale reporting messages. super super class use constructed scale aesthetics ggplot2 aesthetic apply scale , defaults "colour" "fill". breaks set breaks scale, defaults ggplot2::waiver(). na.value color use missing values. guide guide scale, legend. alpha Transparency level 0-1, applied colors NA.

title: Color and Fill Scales for College Basketball Teams and Conferences — scale_cbb
text: ggplot2 color fill scale.

title: Color and Fill Scales for College Basketball Teams and Conferences — scale_cbb
text: scale_color_cbb_teams(): Provides color scales college basketball teams. scale_fill_cbb_teams(): Provides fill scales college basketball teams. scale_color_cbb_conferences(): Provides color scales college basketball conferences. scale_fill_cbb_conferences(): Provides fill scales college basketball conferences.
